text: Excellent cocktail bar. Martinis rank amongst the best I have throughout the world including intercontinental in HK which is my #1. Service & food are good including little neck breaded clams. Traditional Italian pasta dishes got a thumbs up from the group.

This is an amazing Italian restaurant! It's the best I have been to in Chicago. It is a typical lounge style restaurant with great outside seating. The service is great and they treat you well. When you sit down you are served a basket of complimentary fresh baked bread which is very tasty. The menu has a good variety of the basic Italian foods (spaghetti, raviolli, lasagna, Alfredo, ect.)  And They weave in some extra ordinary main dishes along with a great desert menu and many wine options to choose from. The Italian food tastes authentic and the vibe of the restaurant is very calm. There wasn't anything that made me complain at all! Very good, 5 stars!

Threw a bachelorette dinner recently. Was a wonderful night. We used the private space and had a family style dinner. Jim was extremely helpful. We had a few gluten free women and he let them order off the menu which let the rest of the group eat gluten. The service was amazing. Food was delicious. We had 28 people and there was plenty of good food and drinks always being served.  Prices were also reasonable. Would highly recommend.

We went here on a suggestion from a local and we are so glad we decided to try it out. The food was fantastic and the vibe even more so. I was waiting for the "Rat Pack" to come in and take us all back in time. The service was very attentive and the cocktails made it even more fun! After dinner we walked around and loved the energy of the neighborhood.

Great Italian food in bucktown. This place was a short walk from my friends place. We came here after an exhausting bike ride. We had the mozerella friti which was amazing. Perfectly breaded pieces of cheese in a great marinara sauce. I had the rotini with veal meatballs as my entree. It was fairly sizeable portions. The meatballs were okay. They put pieces of fresh mozzarella cheese with the pasta. I enjoyed the entree but it was not stellar. Overall a nice Italian restaurant. I will definitely go back to try some of the other items on the menu and also try some of the cocktails.

I was so excited to try this place because it looked so old school Italian. Instead what I found myself comparing this place to was Pasta Bowl which is amazing and way cheaper than this meal. I got the linguine with clams in red sauce and I felt like the red sauce was so watery I barely had any flavor in the noodles. The clams weren't cooked with the noodles and felt like frozen clams with how tough the texture was when I chewed. I can't believe the prices for this restaurant and how pricey it was for a meal that was this basic in tasting. I much rather go to Pasta Bowl for a more worthwhile and cheaper Italian experience. To soften the blow, I have to admit the bread was tasty.

We were regulars at Club Lucky but after the service we received on our most recent visit we won't be any longer. The hostess/waitress was extremely rude from the moment we asked for a table and then proceeded to give us the silent treatment as if she couldn't be bothered. We were so turned off we left. We should have taken a seat at the bar, bartenders are friendly. Lesson learned.

Great looking place, neighborhood vibe- but disappointing.   People nice, but server had a bit of an attitude and forgot my wine and requested parmesan.   Food good- caprese salad fresh and tasty.  Cavatelli with bolognese  was good , hut not as robust a taste as hoped.  Bottom line- ok, no rushing back.

I thought Club Lucky was the name of a nightclub for twenty-somethings to go drink and dance their young urges away. I was surprised and impressed to find that it's a solid Italian restaurant that I would totally go back to. We ordered the fried calamari ($13.95), which while it was wanting a little more flavor in the breading, was by far the freshest fried calamari I've ever had. I'm not a big friend calamari fan but I would totally order this again. A dozen of their stuffed Little Neck Clams was also very good ($16.95 I think). The Homemade 8 Finger Cavatelli pasta entree was a classic/signature dish of theirs and I really liked this one too. $17.95 The Chicken Francese was done very well $18.95 and I would get this one again too. We topped the night off with their Warm Toll House Cookie $7.95 for dessert. This was pretty decadant. It was nice and nostalgic to a certain point but a little to rich/dense for me.

Delicious Italian food and casual but classy vibe. We happened upon this place on a warm Saturday night. We had a drink at the bar while we waited about 20 minutes for a table outside. My family was in town and my mom wants to come back when she visits again; she said it was the best Veal Francese she's ever had. The bread is also amazing. Highly recommend!

Club Lucky is a classic staple of the Bucktown restaurant scene, off the beaten path with a beautiful patio, bar, party and dining room. They have very solid food and good service.  The only downside is it has gotten very expensive and nothing has really changed to justify the increases. It is probably the area's taxes and the city being so anti business that is causing the increases, but for the price there is better Italian in Chicago, otherwise this would be a 5 star review.

The Mother's Day brunch was awesome, an incredible spread. We had a reservation but ended up in a booth by the bar. It wasn't as loud as the main room and we could hear the great music. All 3 plates of food was excellent as were the drinks. A Flirtini, a substantial Bloody Mary and I finished our daughter's chocolate martini (twist my arm). Love the atmosphere & the food. We'll be back.

Love this place and its decor. One thing I am not that crazy is the noise level and it is kind of hard to hear your friends if you are sitting at a bigger table and in the middle of the dining space. Food is decent and wait staff is friendly.

Food was amazing, the service was excellent by our server Danielle. It was our first time dining there and the experience of having dinner in what use to be a 1940s ballroom is remarkably impressive.  I enjoyed their well crafted cocktails along with one of the best Italian meal I've ever had.  Can't wait to visit again!

Tonight a friend from out of town and I went to club lucky after having gone there for 25 years. We were never treated so poorly!!!  The restaurant was only 1/4 full with many people seated outside and the hostess was told to seat us not in a booth but a small table. We asked for about and after 20 minutes of arguing we were rudely told ok even though the restaurant was less than half full!!!!  In fact, that set the tone for the entire place. I am sure we will not be back and I will tell everyone how awful we were treated by the man who was in charge by the bar!!!

The first time I came here a bowl of spaghetti was $6 that was 1993 24 years later the price may have changed but nothing else has except they now cut the Italian sausage without spaghetti and that's something I can deal with
Great food, great martinis, great service. No frills Italian and reasonably priced. Absolutely love this place!

Who doesn't love a supper club? And this one is Italian. Nice vibe in the front bar and a perfectly poured dirty martini. Classic Italian menu executed well. Even the bread and olive oil was a notch better than expected. Caesar salad was heavily dressed, but full of crunch. Pasta was great. My only complaints: spotty service (friendly but slow) and weird vibration that dominated the booth. We noticed it as soon as we sat down, the host assured us we we're not imagining it. But did not offer to move us. There must be some sort of mechanical equipment/boiler/earth-shaking craziness adjacent to the property. Skip the oddly vibrating booths and sit at a free-standing tables. Or, better yet, grab a spot in the bar.

Went here when daughter was young often. Got our old seat on back booth near window. Remember the cold snowy days feeling warm and cozy there. This time was a semi-business meeting and was enjoyable. Martinis are great here. My salmon vesuvio was not memorable and that is why the 3. But I got what I had expected and loved the atmosphere and remembrances. Will always return from time to time. Go for the martinis, atmosphere, and retro ambiance. Good place for parents with kids I think. Also the bar and booth area is a nice option.
Went on a prohibition tour and had amazing drinks. When we smelled the food we knew we had to go back. Had the best veal parm of my life. So succulent and juicy and the cheese was amazing.

A group of 8 of us started our Chicago trip at Club Lucky. This retro Italian restaurant is a must go to for down to earth Italian-American fare. Eggplant Parm was well done with crisp eggplant and lots of sauce and mozzarella. Caesar Chicken was tasty with a great dressing as well as tasty chicken. Linguini primavera and Lasagna was standard Italian-American fare and very tasty. Homemade cavetelli was tender and the robust tomato sauce tasted like my grandma's. What really finished the meal was cannoli and spumoni...I thought I was on the lower east side NYC!! Kudos to staff and chefs!
My favorite bar in chicago nice atmosphere and service drinks where great & not to expensed

This place is awesome. We came on a wednesday night and got seated immediately. Looks really unassuming from the outside but inside it was fairly crowded with a lot of business professional people lounging around.  The free bread and olive oil at the table is so good I could eat that for my entire meal. I got the eggplant parm and it comes with a side of pasta. It was the best eggplant parm i've ever had. And i really don't say that lightly, I'm from NJ aka little italy so I've had my fair share of eggplant parm in my life. This was the best.  I asked my server to make it extra spicy which i kind of regretted later because it was 2 hot 2 handle but I ate it anyway because I'm not a wimp. This place is in such a random location but honestly you should give it a shot it's seriously good.

Love this place !! I made same day reservations for 8:30 and was immediately sat. Staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Ambiance was family like and comfortable, but loud and made it difficult to conversate with my date. I love neighborhood hole in the wall places like this. The inside was a lot bigger than expected. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti noodles with a Moscow mule. Everything was on point and delicious! This will definitely be the new go to spot

Club Lucky has been on our Happy List for a very long time. You'd never guess as you walk by and see the neon Club Lucky sign what lies inside. It's deceptively large with the feel of a 1950's Italian Supper Club inside and it's typically packed with patrons so reservations are a good idea.  Their food is awesome! Unquestionably the best calamari I've ever tasted anywhere. We order calamari everywhere we go and Club Lucky wins! There's a massive menu of Italian classics, fresh fish specials expertly prepared, the Club Lucky salad is a great starter and their fresh bread dipped in olive oil and spices is addicting. Wine markups by the bottle are minimal which encourages you to order a bottle to really enjoy your dinner. Service is always attentive and never fails to leave you with the feeling that you're a very appreciated customer. That's huge! Our daughter's bulldogs have always enjoyed the full water bowl & a jar of biscuits out front on their Bucktown walks & the outdoor patio is dog friendly in the summer. These small details are never overlooked here. We love this place!!

I went to CLub Lucky with minimal expectations.  A work associate had been there before and suggested it so I was happy to try it. I walked in before dinner, without a reservation and had a drink and appetizer at the bar.  The bartender was very friendly and timely with the drinks.  The sausage app was great and things were off to a good start.  The rest of our party showed up and we went to be seated.  We had dinner at 6pm and things were a bit empty at that point.  The menu is easy to understand and offers all the things you'd expect with an Italian restaurant.  I got the 8 fingers with 2 beef meatballs.  The food was absolutely excellent! I was blown away by how good the service, food and atmosphere.  We kept ordering drinks and they were always a strong pour and the final bill was very reasonable for the food and drinks we ordered.  By the time we left around 9pm the place was buzzing it had so many people there.  There is enough room for small and larger groups, families, couples, etc.  I would absolutely recommend Club Lucky to anyone looking for a great meal at a Mom and Pop restaurant.

Can't believe I've not yet reviewed Club Lucky. Been going here for years and it has been a tried and true standby for delightful,  legitimate, home style Italian food. Portion sizes are huge - sort of like what your Italian grandmother might pile on your plate cause you are a growing boy and need fed. Don't even get me started about how many meals you can get out of the lasagna entree. Wow. And tasty? You bet. I always order the calamari because it's probably the best I've ever had. Bold statement to be sure but I always test an Italian restaurant by their calamari. If you find any better than this please let me know! It's a comfortable place, great service, terrific salads, spectacular specials, and they always have water bowls and a container of dog biscuits outside the front door. A terrific neighborhood restaurant worthy of your patronage. Look for me with a container of leftovers that will be my dinner tomorrow. Yum.

Great food, great atmosphere... solid neighborhood gem.   Try the signature cocktails! Took a group of 7 for a birthday and everyone was thrilled with the food and decor.  Ask about the history of the place while you are there!

Originally we were very excited to find Club Lucky. It's a fun spot and the staff was all welcoming and warm. The food was good. However, over the past two years, the food quality has declined; now bordering on ordinary. Very recently (04 FEB 2017) ordered chicken parm (via delivery mind you) and it was just OK. Maybe a 6 out of a possible 10. Alas, time to frequent another Italian restaurant--perhaps one whose name begins with 'Club' as well ;-)

What a neat place! You must make reservations and just plan on using the valet $11 + tip. Cool vibe - very old school feel. Service is excellent and food was fantastic. I am not a huge bread person but the super soft Italian bread and garlic infused olive oil before the meal is insane! I am also not a huge pasta person so was interested in a fish special - cordina & spinach - have never had it before and was a little apprehensive so I asked the server and she assured me it was very good - my other option was shrimp scampi. So glad I trusted her! It was delicious! My friends all had pasta dishes and they loved theirs as well.

What is there not to love about this "old-school" Italian-American red sauce joint? Prices are fair, portions are good-sized and they stick to all of the classic dishes you would expect to find. Everything on the menu sounded great, it was hard to choose. Food was delicious, service warm and friendly plus attentive to our needs. Definite winner!

If you want a jar of ragu sauces poured over your pasta I highly recommend club lucky. A meat and cheese dish for $20 with 9 pieces of salami and 6 pieces of cheese... the service was not the best, the only thing they have going for them is their bread at the beginning of the meal.

Club Lucky is our favorite restaurant in Bucktown. We first went over a year ago and have dined in about 8 times and had carry out about 4 times since. The food is excellent, the old school vibe that doesn't feel like it's trying to hard is amazing, and the jukebox that seems like Sinatra is always playing in the front makes getting a drink in the front bar area before dinner a fun tradition. Service is always top notch, highly recommend Club Lucky!

Adorable Christmas decorations but it ends there. Seated in a freezing cold side room at 5:00 due to large parties that they put in the main dining room instead of the other way around, that was with a reservation we had for a week. They won an award a few years ago for the best cocktail in Chicago but IT IS NOT AVAILABLE TO ORDER! The food was mediocre at best. Found two little pieces of fig in the FIG salad, my shrimp was way over cooked and not even hot. How that is possible I don't know, maybe the food sat there waiting to be delivered. My son had the veal marsala at the suggestion of the server it was like shoe leather my husband's chicken dry as a bone the two other dishes were barely passable. Too many fabulous Italian restaurants to go in Chicago for the same money, do yourself a favor take a pass on this place. One star for decor one for a nice server. That is it!
Delicious homemade pasta and amazing lamb chops! Retro Italian restaurant with great food. Homey, neighborhood feel.

A FANTASTIC restaurant! I've been going here for years and the food is consistently fantastic. Everything that I've ordered on their menu was great and it's even better for leftovers the next day. Their bread is also to die for, in my opinion. 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for delicious Italian food!

We just had our Knights of Columbus Christmas Party catered and Club Lucky delivered, prepared a great meal and we did have one problem -TOO MUCH FOOD.  We ordered for 30 and it felt that we ordered for 50 people.  My Brother Knights were thrilled that the food was in abundance and the price was just awesome.  The food was absolutely delicious.  My Brother Knights took food home. Our members are planning on having all of our events either catered or eating at the restaurant. Club Lucky, thank you for making our event special.
Probably one of the better real Southern Italian restaurants I have eaten in. Wonderful authentic atmosphere of the 1940,s.  Worth having a fun evening with great food

I have been going to Club Lucky for 12 years. This restaurant makes me feel like I've gone back to my childhood. I atmosphere is fantastic; vibrant with a mixed crowd. The Calamari Calabrese is a must, with the most tender calamari I've had outside of my own kitchen. The Escarole soup with sausage and beans is so delicious. It brings me back to my nonna's kitchen when I was a child! The Penne Arrabiata has just enough bite and the pasta is always al dente. I recommend the Amaretto Ricotta Cheesecake for desert. The service is usually great (I've only had 2 mediocre experiences in 12 years). If you're ever in Bucktown, Club Lucky is the place to go for a great meal!

Bucktown neighborhood staple! I can't believe my husband and I had never been there before!  We went last night after a long day downtown (tree lighting parade and Chriskindlemarkt) and made an open table reservation for 9pm. We arrived a few minutes early and were seated immediately. The service was amazing-- quick and friendly! The food was great too. My husband had the special ravioli and I had a pasta with sausage! They offer a gluten free rotini for anyone avoiding gluten or who have celiac disease.  The atmosphere is great too, especially for this time of year. It looked like Christmas exploded in there (ha, in a good way... so cute).  We live a short walk away and will definitely be back!

Came here with my son and they were very accommodating to us especially it being a Saturday night with a 5 year old.  Their staff was so nice and friendly and loved my son.  They don't have a kids' menu but they do have chicken fingers which my son loved of course.  I had the chicken francese which came on top of a bed of spinach.  It was very good.  We ordered the warm chocolate chip cookie for dessert and they put all the toppings on the side for us with no problem since my son likes it plain but I like all the additions.  The restaurant itself is an old Italian place, almost like a diner but much nicer.  They have 3 separate rooms.  I would love to come back to try other dinners as well as go inside the Club Room.

Three stars for the meatballs, the service, ambiance, and old school feel. I'm not too excited about the food. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, Fettucine De Campo, but it seemed to lack flavor. I'm willing to go back and try a new dish though.

Ive lived down the street from club lucky for 3 years. I admit I should take more advantage of their cuisine. Every meal I have had has been a hit! Their marinara sauce is to die for. Side note- they sell jars of it!! Anyway, it is a wonderful atmosphere and their Italian food is top notch for a neighborhood restaurant. Worth checking out. Only negative- im not sold on their wine.

The hot, fresh, soft bread and olive oil/parm is reason enough to come. You can stop reading now if you'd like.  Neighborhood favorite. Awesome location hidden in a amongst Bucktown brick. The bar area is classic and cozy. The dining hall is huge and family friendly.  The food is delicious and reasonably priced. My go to is a dry gin Martini, the pasta campari and some red wine to polish it off

I seriously hate that I haven't been here before - I absolutely loved this place! Great service and atmosphere. Their Moscow Mules were delicious and the chicken parm was pretty good. They were extremely generous with the chicken. The desserts were legit! Everything was perfectly timed - food was on time and our drinks never went empty. I will definitely go back!

Club Lucky's atmosphere is reason enough to go there. It feels like you have transcended time and are floating across bygone great old days. I have eaten most of their dishes but I think the best one so far is the eggplant parm. Never bitter, no skin, sweet, delicious, moist, never oily. Perfection. Eggplant can be tricky, you know. I take the pasta fagiole to work for lunch.  It revitalizes me and it makes me feel like I'm special while all the other fools at my job eat their lousy lunches, I am sitting at a trattoria in Bari, Italy wishing I could wash the silky and zesty elixir down with some of Club Lucky's splendid choices of wine!  Fantastico!!

A favorite neighborhood gem. I've dined on multiple occasions and every time was exceptional. From the service to the food. The servers are incredibly knowledgeable and made us feel right at home. A fantastic family owned establishment!
Great spot with a cool mixed crowd. Martinis and cavatelli to die for! Manager presence is fantastic but not over done. No matter how busy they're always accommodating.

This place is awesome! It has an old school ambience with fast, professional service. The food is excellent and the cocktails never disappoint. If you want to experience a legitimate piece of Chicago history and enjoy a fantastic meal, this is the place! It's also a really cool spot to meet up for drinks. I'm not sure what some of these negative reviewers are talking about. Food and service have always been excellent for me and I've been going here for years. Maybe their jeans were too tight?

I have been to Club Lucky maybe 50 to 60 times and never has the service been this bad. The server could not have been more unattentive if he tried. No follow up after food was delivered to the table snarky attitude not to mention he never asked if we wanted another round of drinks or a dessert afterwards. Thankfully the food as always was what I've come to expect. Upon reading some of the other reviews I can't help but wonder if my server was the same one mentioned in a earlier post. I will return...however, it will be awhile before that happens. We  arrived around 9ish on 9/11/2016 and sat outside maybe this will help identify the server!
Love the bar and neighborhood vibe here. Food is family style and always solid. Jukebox is awesome!

My gal pal and I went last night around 6pm. The patio was wide open, and we asked to sit at a 4 top. The "host" told us no, those were for parties of 4, and sat us at a 2 top at the bottom of the stairs. Meanwhile, there is a M/F couple seated at a 4 top at the other end....and lo-and-behold, another M/F couple is seated at a 4 top as we wrap up our dinner. Apparently, 4 tops are "reserved" for 2 diners only if one of them is a male. Really? Last time here for sure.

Mike at the bar was awesome. Great ambiance in the bar.  It stopped there. We ate outside, ok space other than the ongoing drum guy going on a few doors away.  Food was fine, just fine. Very uninteresting. But service was terrible. How many times do I have to go and find our server? Completely ignored all night. She had no interest in us.  We've enjoyed Club Lucky before - we'll find other places instead.

Update!!!  Club Lucky is all the sudden the Shiznit and Burt couldn't be happier! Last time Burt reviewed Club Lucky he went on about how he loved the atmosphere but the food wasn't as good as it should be. Burt begged them to hire a new chef. BOOM mothafu(kaaaaa , they listened to Burt! Lamb chops and bread are still awesome. But now it seems everything tastes delicious. Ribs are fall off the bone incredible!!!  Chicken franchase fuggetaboutit !!!  Meatball salad, lobster ravioli, sausage n peppers, pepper and egg sssssangwich.  Burt says it's all good.  If ur observant, U will notice some bad ass '77 Trans Am burnout marks in the street in front of this Choke and Puke. You'll also notice Burt inside stuffing his face wearing a cowboy hat and red button down along side his phat ass wife.  Club Lucky - 10 Trans Ams (highest rating)

Great old- time ambiance. They are known for their martinis and did not disappoint! Service and pacing of the meal was excellent. I had the date salad first. It was delicious and not overly sweet. For the main course, there were meatballs, ziti, chicken francaise and shrimp marinara with vegetables over spinach. No complaints from anyone. Desserts were first- rate as well. Home made strawberry gelato with chocolate chips, tartufo and chocolate chip cookie with ice cream. I can't wait to return. There is a nice outdoor patio for dining weather permitting.
I'm not reviewing the food. We stopped here during a Chicago prohibition tour for some classy cocktails... The bartenders know what they are doing here!

If you ever wanted to have the feeling that you were gonna get whacked, this is the place to go. Absolutely fabulous homemade pasta.  As soon as you walk in, you'll know you are in the right spot. Thank me later!

Great atmosphere, service and food.  This place is  a staple in the bucktown neighborhood and Chicago.  From just wanting to grab a quick dinner to having a birthday dinner with friends for special occasions club lucky is always on the short list of great places!

Boo! What happened? We have going to Club Lucky since the late 90's and I know that there have been some drastic changes this past year, but so disappointed.  We try to eat here at least twice a month and last night we had our usual (the only item we ever order) Clam Linguine with Red Sauce. It was like a bowl of salt and the sauce was watery and almost clear, not the usual red sauce.  I'm so sad .... I don't think we will go back now :(  You were a great spot for so many years, I am just sad that it had to end this way.

Awesome little neighborhood corner bar and restaurant with a great outdoor atmosphere and friendly staff . One of those places you'll be excited to bring your friends to if you live in the area. Wrap around patio seating with a peaceful neighborhood vibe. Definitely a hidden gem.
Big disappointment.everything we ordered was mediocre. A dingy bar/ restaurant that has a nice Italian menu. But it does not know how to execute it. Stay away.

My husband and I have been dining at Club Lucky at least once a month for the last two years. It's our favorite Italian restaurant in the city. The food, drinks and service are always fabulous! I love the atmosphere! Very authentic Italian, you can't go wrong with this place!
Great food and atmosphere. Very attentive staff! Old school Italian supper club feel. This spot is quickly being my regular.

Oh Please. Been coming here since the dawn of time. Always a great experience. Friendly bartenders and front desk staff. Hubby loves the eggplant Parmesan. The chicken parm is also excellent. LOVE the chicken pastina soup. Homemade and delicious. Frank Sinatra playing as always. A great local place in Bucktown. The warm bread and seasoned oil is the killer.

Loved the space and décor, including a Picassoesque iron sculpture on one wall.  Had the linguine with little neck clams in a red sauce-delicious, and a great red wine (Masciarelli 2013 Montepulciano D'Abruzzo), the bar and dining room was so pleasant, friendly, I wish I were there now.  This is my new favorite place.

Charming and delicious--In town to meet our daughter's boyfriend's parents and we couldn't have picked a better place. Charming atmosphere. Impeccable service. Scrumptious food. Top picks for the night--Calamari, Baby back ribs with parmesan mashed potatoes, Fettuccine de campo, Linguine with little neck clams, Chicken parmigiana. Finishing it off with tiramisu.  Every dish was exceptionally delicious.  A lovely evening.

This was such an amazing place! The garlic infused oil might have been my favorite thing of the night. I ordered the fettucini alfredo with chicken- the chicken was awesome, but the alfredo itself didn't have much flavor. I had to add a ton of salt, pepper, cheese- essentially everything I could find on the table to give it some flavor. This was a great place for a big group. Ambiance was fun, cocktails were amazing. All around great evening!

The food is OK, better than Olive Garden, but not much better.  Basically, this is a poser joint for tourists rather than real urbanites or people that know what real Italian food should be like.  But hey, if you're on a date with a young lady in her low 20s and/or have some friends from the burbs with you, sure go there.... they'll be impressed!  ha ha
Really nice place. Great interior, not too crowded. Great food; they give you a lot. The chicken parmesan is superb. Love the bread they give you for free at the beginning.

This is my local restaurant, and I love it.  I have been here with family and kids, friends from out of town and dates.  Everyone has been impressed by the service and the food.  The fried calamari, fig mission salad, seafood pasta with bread crumbs and brick chicken (special) are big favorites.  Sitting outside in the nice weather with a glass of wine is a true Bucktown experience.  Weekends having a drink at the bar is always fun and the jukebox may lead to spontaneous dancing if the mood is right.  A true neighborhood treasure.

The food was excellent. My wife and I had salmon and it was prepared perfectly. The ravioli with a pomadoro sauce was excellent as well. Dessert was Italian ricotta cheese cake. The service was A1. Nice wine selection. For a neighborhood restaurant, this deserves 5 stars. It's a place that I would certainly bring my friends to. See you soon at club Lucky!

I've been eating at Club Lucky for years and I recently dined there last night much to my chagrin. The service was terrible (bad attitude) but the food was worse. My linguini with olive oil and garlic wasn't properly seasoned nor did it have any taste. I also tasted a friend's eggplant parmigiana, and, again, it lacked flavor and the sauce was watery. So, what's happened to this once yummy restaurant? I'm very disappointed.
This was one of our stop on a Chicago "Prohibition Tour".  You can see gun shot on the bar from the 1970"s (I think that is the year).  We had fantastic Italian Sausages and Trendy Cocktails.

2 stars due to the take out issues I have had. It's always a fun time at CL. But as a neighbor for 10 years I sometimes get take out-- the last two times I have gotten take out there's been an issue. Last time I called and they were nice enough to send me a gift card-but I couldn't believe last night--ordered chicken francese--that's what it said on the ticket on the package but they gave us VEAL! Great to visit--but take out needs to get their act together.

Worth the drive no matter where your coming from.  Great service, food and atmosphere.  Calamari was amazing.  String bean salad is a must.  I would have had seconds of baked chicken oreganato but I was too full. The restaurant is a must stop destination.

FIVE STAR Club Lucky Manhnattan!!! This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city of Chicago. The service is always stellar. The food is simply delightful. Fresh bread and the Club Lucky salad is my go to simple dinner, but the rib special was out of this world. Love love love.

First time visit with family of 7 on a Sunday, 3:30 PM.   No crowd at this time of day and we were able to use the complimentary parking along the wall located next to the restaurant.   This is a true Italian Restaurant with delicious food.  Service was great because we were the only diners present at opening hours but a couple of other families entered  after we had been there for about an hour and they, too, were receiving the same.  I ordered the Penne with a nicely flavored sauce and amazing Italian Sausage.  Others enjoyed the grilled salmon, ribs, spaghetti and meatballs along with 2 helpings of that amazing, delicious warm bread and oil for dipping, calamari, etc.etc.  The music track was enjoyable, too.  When we departed, about two hours later, the bar area was full with standing room only and other diners were entering as well.  Very nice, comfortable, large dining areas.
Favorite place to meet girlfriends or for a date. Food is always high quality and consistent. Get the Italian sausage and all the pastas are amazing. Start with a martini.

I moved to Bucktown the same year Club Lucky opened. 25+ years later & it is still that great neighborhood place. The Club Lucky salad still is the staple. The antipasti appetizer was delicious! Although I did not know much of the new staff, they were more than welcoming! What a great atmosphere; fun, invigorating and inviting! Kudos Jimmy Higgins, you rock!

A group of us went here the other night for our girlfriends birthday. Everything was phenomenal! Service was great! Our server was so sweet and when it came to needing help with food and wine options she definitely didn't disappoint! The food was amazing, from our apps to the dessert. Calamari, crab cakes, pastas, salmon, scallops and of course dessert tiramisu and Profiteroles. We all enjoyed ourselves and had a great time. I cant wait to go back!

Found this place as part of the prohibition tour group. Amazing appetizers. Great service. And even better cocktails. Friendly, knowledgeable and engaging staff. This place is awesome. Highly recommended for craft cocktails and more! Hope to come back next time in Chicago.

Worst take out in the world ! Ordered simple pasta  with NO meat and club lucky salad.  Instead I waited 15 min after they had already told me my order was done . They mess up my Oder and had to remake so they said then gave me burnt food and horrible salad with no dressing. This place used to be good now .I will never step a foot there

I've been to club lucky a couple times. Last time I went I felt the quality of food wasn't as good as it used to be. It seemed like our food came out really fast. I wasn't impressed and the price for quality didn't fit well. Prob won't go back.

My company has been hosting the same annual training in Chicago for the past four years. We always go to Club Lucky one of the nights for dinner because not only is the food delicious, but the family style works so well for our group and the restaurant is amazing! The staff treats us so well and is incredibly efficient. Our participants had a wonderful time at dinner and we look forward to future dinners. If planning a dinner for a lot of people, I highly recommend looking into Club Lucky!

This is the second time I have been to Club Lucky, and I just want to say the food is fantastic. The staff is super nice, and the food is out of this world. Their vodka cream sauce is spot on. The bread was warm when it came to the table. Their caesar salad has very flavorful dressing. My boyfriend and I got the sausage and peppers, and it was delicious. Overall, a fun restaurant that knows how to make great italian food!

Chicken Marsala Late night delivery after a long day and I can't even imagine what it would taste like if I dine-in! I was absolutely fantastic! I love every single bite down to the last one. So good I drank the juice!

This has to be one of the top 10 places to go for great food,excellent customer service,and a bill that doesn't  need a mortgage.  Been going here for 10 years now and I have to say I prefer this over some of the fancy restaurants on Michigan Avenue

Great food and cocktails, great atmosphere, and attentive staff!  We were just here for our good friends' engagement party and loved everything that we were served. Didn't realize there was an entire back room since I've never really gone past the bar and have eaten outside during the summer-- this place is huge. Their cocktails are amazing and their CHOCOLATE CAKE is to die for!

Named after the little ol' neighborhood bar that stood there for many years, we've been going to Club Lucky since it opened in the early 90's. The food and service have always been great. Anything on the menu is good. We usually get the grilled calamari and Club Lucky salad, along with whatever else seems fit for the evening.
Club Lucky has it all. Great food, libations, staff, friendly atmosphere and killer jukebox. A must place to go in Chicago.

Had a delicious dinner here last night (it's always great!), BUT felt completely rushed!  The waitress stopped by our table about every three minutes to see how everything was, and as soon as we ordered dessert (before it got to our table), she brought us the check.  We had planned on ordering an after dinner drink, but got the message that it was time for us to leave.  We only had one drink with dinner, so I guess since we weren't a large party, pounding drinks with dinner, they wanted us out.  They do a fantastic business, so I'm sure they were hoping the next group to come to our table would be drinking their dinner.  HO HO HO

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago, but haven't been back in awhile. Decided to visit the other nite. The host was friendly, as well as the waitress. The food was quite good as well. The problem, which is why I can't give this place more than 2 stars, is that the noise level is rather extreme, bad acoustics, loud music, etc. But the main issue I have is really with the poor ventilation. The whole place smelled like the kitchen: grilled meat, burnt smells, etc. I left with my clothes smelling like the place, and was glad that I didn't get sick. Perhaps I will visit again in the off-season, or for lunch, but probably not anytime soon.

Club Lucky has energy...that's my favorite part of this place! The food is nice and heavy. My husband had fettuccini and I had the linguini with mixed vegetables. The Alfredo sauce is awesome, so I also got a side order of just the sauce and we also enjoyed the Club Lucky salad. The food is good, but definitely not unique.  I loved my cocktail: the Always Lucky martini was spot on and the blue cheese olives were amazing. Highly recommend this drink.  The service was good. They definitely take their time with your order, and it's not a place you're going to be in and out in 45 minutes. It's a longer dining experience. The bus people are a little too attentive, and I wish they wouldn't try to take my food every few minutes, but at least the staff cares.  Really enjoyed the experience and definitely recommend going around the holidays to see the beautiful decor.

This is a neighborhood gem, with friendly staff, yummy food, an old-school atmosphere, and some wonderful drinks. I dine here frequently, and am always pleased. They serve a wonderful Negroni made with bitters. Classy and masculine! Choose anything on the menu - it's good. The antipasto, pasta e fagioli, meat dishes, salads. Portions are plenty but not excessive. The homemade bread is the best! I'd give five stars, but the zealous busboys who try to clear plates away too fast and interrupt your conversation deduct one. Sometimes it's more chill to eat at the bar than in the dining room. Great place!

The food is a solid 3 star with some items a 4 star, but the ambiance/aesthetics are pleasing...so I give that a 5star. It's a local joint with a small town Italian family feel, lots of noise, people chatting, dishes clanking, glasses cheering....lots of fun. It is the exact opposite of the quiet romantic Italian restuarant....this is family Italian

went here last week with my husband. i was here years ago, but didn't  remember any aspect.  this time: noisy, too dark to see what we were eating, waaaaay  overpriced, and our server made certain he told us that his father owns  the place. bragging so immediately i didn't like the guy.  he certainly added to that  feeling when, as he presented us the check, he said (and i  quote):"gratuity is not included in your bill." WHAAAT? rude, unnecessary, thoughtless. i wanted to say something to him  right away, but i got the evil eye from my husband, so writing this  review (and writing to club lucky---no response yet) is the next best  thing. we won't be going there again.

Second time visiting this place. The food was great again, I ordered the daily special salmon was cooked to perfection. My gf ordered the ravioli and loved it. The waiter on the other hand I think his name was Phillip was horrible! Made sure he services every other table around us before acknowledging us. I asked what a few of the craft beer selections were, he had no clue. She ordered a margarita which she did not like and only took a sip of, the whole time it sat there full he never asked if there was a problem with the drink. The bus boy was more accommodating that's the waiter. Long story short the food and atmosphere is great I would recommend to all, but if you happen to be seated in Phillips section good luck!
Great place! Awesome neighborhood. The cocktails are especially good. Don't miss the Moscow mule. They make their own pasta and it's incredible.

We've been coming here for years... especially during the holidays when it's all decked out. (Yes, Thanksgiving isn't even here and Club Lucky is already donning its finest Christmas decor, which I thought would annoy me, but instead, it got me excited for the holidays!) The food here is spectacular, the martinis superb, but I'm writing this review tonight because something not-so-great, but totally not the restaurant's fault, happened tonight... The waitress dealt with it immediately and honestly couldn't have been nicer, the manager came over immediately and apologized (again, wasn't the restaurant's fault, though). They comped our meal. I just thought it was such a refreshing and professional way to handle a situation that could easily have turned ugly quick. Club Lucky remains on my list of favorite dinner spots.

Stopped here on my way from downtown to O'Hare on the Blue Line.  Get off at Damen and walk about 4 blocks, it will be worth it.  Sat at the bar and had perfect service.  Had the veal meatball sandwich with fries.  Definitely worth the extra buck for the melted mozzarella cheese. Great atmosphere and great food.  Have not been here in about 15 years and the food is as good or better than I remember.  Cannot wait to bring my wife here in the future.   Thanks Club Lucky!
HEAVY chi-town grub here but tasty as hell. :) A super casual place with good beverages and a deep whisky/scotch selection. Great neighborhood place that won't break the bank.

I have never had a bad night at Club Lucky. The food is wonderful, the drinks are well made and reasonably priced and the staff is great. If you're there to eat then you will never go wrong ordering from the daily specials. Everything is freshly made and fantastic. My default for years has been the linguine with clams and white wine sauce. Absolutely perfect! Great olive options for your martini too. Also, there is a private room in the back that is perfect for hosting small dinner parties.

Awful.  Food is fair at best. Not really up to snuff taste or presentation wise.  No manager presence really, and looks like a beat up old diner. Manager kept shaking hands with what seemed like salespeople instead of guests.  No personality, and a pretty Blaise selection of wines.  Can't believe this place is still in business putting such a crappy product.  Won't be back, and don't see them lasting much longer at this rate.

To call my delivery experience with Club Lucky horrible would be an understatement. My wife and I ordered some nice Italian food for our night in.  Here was our order, Homemade Eggplant Parmigiana, Homemade Tortellinis  and some Tiramisu. This food cost $63 total for delivery.  It came with 2 small pieces of bread to go with the tiny portions.  It should be noted that it was cold, but that shouldn't be held against them, since it was delivery and that can happen.  However the quality of the food was a slight notch above chef boyardee.  Overall between the quality of the food, the cost and the length of delivery, I'd say its the worst takeout experience of my life. I will not be going back and feel ripped off.
Try to cabrese calamari and the baby back ribs. Amazing every time. Good service, great food, amazing spot!!!

Great neighborhood Italian spot.  Very family friendly but not just a family place.   Food has always been consistent and good, nice portion size and always friendly service.   I recommend this place.

This is a 5 star review and shout out to our bus boy. He was doing his best to keep all of his tables happy under difficult, short staffed conditions, and especially when people weren't being very patient or kind to him. Everyone has a bad day, and this kid deserves a high five for trying his best to keep his cool and  a smile on his face!

Went here for my friends bday lunch. I thought food was okay not amazing but I would like to try other things if I go again. I tried bruschetta, italia sausage and chicken tortellini with peas dish. The tortellini I. Vodka sauce was delish. I Def enjoyed it. The appetizers were just ok. I would return for Italian if in area and had a taste for it,

great place but sevice is what i call super slow ive been comeing for some time and for some reason it take time to order the food is great its the sevice wake up lucky thers orther places to eat that do better sevice !
This is one of my faves in Chicago. Ever since I lived in Wicker Park. The Martini's are great and the atmosphere both inside and out is wonderful.

This place is a really cute, old Italian restaurant! We came with a big group so I'd love to go back with a smaller group to have more of an intimate experience. I had spaghetti and meatballs, it was delicious! Everyone loved their meals! As a warning, they can only split bills on 2 or 3 cards so just bring cash incase.
I love coming on Tuesdays for their 6 dollar martinis. There's free parking on parts of Wabansia and all of honore. I love the outside seating in the summer and the food has been great.

Really a great place.  Wonderful selection at the bar.  Also service is wonderful, more of a neighborhood feel.  And the filet is dynamite, more so for an Italian restaurant.  We visit here frequently.

This is my favorite restaurant in Chicago. To all the haters, you know nothing. This place has the most comfortable ambiance, phenomenal service, fantastic cocktails, and even better food.  I could go on and on and ON about all that I have ordered here, but there is no need. Order from the specials and you will not be disappointed. Or try a classic dish. Or sample one of the appetizers! It's all unreal.  Also, side note: the restaurant is SPOTLESS. Not a speck of dust or grime in the whole damn joint. And I am a crazy neat freak. I have been frequenting this place for 4 years, bringing friends and family, Club Lucky is always a hit!!!!  Keep it up, you guys! We love you.

A classic Chicago Italian restaurant! I love the atmosphere, the food, drinks, and service. The building is quaint and charming. The usual Italian specialties are well made. Although they only have a couple of steaks on the menu, they must be quite good as I noticed they sell a lot of them. The restaurant had a strong steak smell throughout. I'll definitely get one the next time I go.  Be sure to get the special house salad. It's awesome in every way.

This place is solid, but you will be just as happy going to Olive Garden. I had the shrimp scampi and then cheesecake for dessert. It was all just fine. I tried my daughter's ravioli which was better than my dish. I don't think I'll be back- there's just too many other (better) restaurants out there.

Excellent meal. For the third time in a row now, the ditzy bartender has made my meal less than pleasant. I used to come in and sit at the bar after a long day for a nice meal and welcoming service but it seems that she can't get the simple things that make a restaurant welcoming right or get your requests right. She walked by me three times (and I am the only one at the bar) and didn't acknowledge my presence even though I was looking directly at her to ask for something. By the time she finally asked what I wanted I was just ready to go. Paid $45 for a meal and walking home now steaming instead of satisfied.

We have been going to Club Lucky for Mothers Day Brunch since the first one about 6 years ago.   I almost want to keep it our secret, but it is a great place for this event.   Food is really good and plentiful.    Sometimes a tray is empty, but rest assured, it will be full (and fresh) the next time around.    The mix of breakfast and Italian lunch is always great.   It has become a tradition over the years.   They have valet parking for 9$.   Well worth it with the wife, mother-in-law, and the kids.   What I really appreciate is the "homey" feel.  I know where I'll be next year!!!

This is our go-to-spot for home cooked Italian, the way it should be done. Bread & herb-infused oil to start, then caprese salad with reduced balsamic. I like the veal/chicken parm, also shrimp fettuccine alfredo- but bring an appetite! Usually too stuffed for dessert, but had their tiramisu- amazing, and I'm not a tiramisu lover, until now!
Meatball salad and pasta.  Wonderful!  Their warm bread and butter compliments everything.  The atmosphere and the service is great.  Everyone is friendly and knowledgable about their menu.

Everything at Club Lucky is good, much of it, like the Chicken Marsala and Pasta Fagiole, is great. But lately the Minestrone has been...what's the word? Sublime? Surreal? Sensational? It's better than any I had in Italy, put it that way.

Very accommodating of vegetarians. They have good knowledge of which dishes are or are not made with animal products, and are happy to ask the chef if they don't. Very easy to order, even if you want something modified or substituted. Most components in the menu can be had with most other components. Extensive alcohol selection, and they specialize in martinis. The table service is frequent and friendly. We live around the corner so I can't comment on the valet parking, and it would be a conflict of interest for me to recommend street parking.

I couldn't recommend a better local place to eat! The staff is friendly, the food is amazing and it's all placed in a family friendly atmosphere. My compliments to the chef, owners, and waitstaff. I look for excuses to eat here. Luckily I work close by, so that isn't an issue.

Nailed it. Went in here with a couple girlfriends before the hawks game on Friday and it was fantastic. We were seated immediately which was shocking for the day and time so we were pumped.  Busser immediately brought bread and waters (YES BREAD) and our server was really helpful with the wine selection and we settled on a midrange Cabernet. Delicious and well paired for all of us.  Tried the mozzarella fritti and the sauce made us extremely anxious for our meals, super tasty! I had the penne arrabiatta which absolutely killllled me. Perfect amount of spice and the pasta was the perfect al dente. We will absolutely be back!

Giving it two stars for the lovely outdoor seating and the good martini. Everything else was pretty disappointing. Our waitress was not attentive...I mean, we had to flag her down to order more booze! The bottle of wine that they recommended was terrible and we were not able to try it ahead of time. My chicken was dry and their "famous calamari" was bland and totally average. Really bummed about this place as we are new to the neighborhood and it had so much potential! Won't be back.

'6 star experience every-time' CL has my favorite "beverage-program" in town.  You and a dozen friends want a nice bottle of armagnac or absinthe... They got you.  Maybe a house made limoncello. Hungry? Don't  stop at the a.w.e.s.o.m.e appetizers the entrees and deserts deserve your attention.  The look and feel of Club Lucky is easy to be in for me and they go all out decorating for the holidays.  The patio seating makes a few hours just breeze by.  I have booked nearly a dozen dinners with 2-3 dozen folks and have been wowed with the attention paid to us before, during, and after.  They even have worked up menus for us that are not "on the menu".  (not that I could tire of the very thoughtful menu) Planning a special night or need one at the last second, Club Lucky has you covered.

Wow was that good! Love this place - it's in a neighborhood - they have valet. We made reservations and got right in. It was full on a Friday night but not uncomfortably packed. The service is amazing. Our server (Stephen V) was so nice, knowledgable and just pleasant. Even the bus folks were so friendly and easy going. The food came out fast but I never felt rushed and it was so good. I would have been happy with the table bread - that is amazing - warm, soft, delicious. We changed our mind several times but decided on eggplant parm for me and chicken parm for my man. He asked to have the chicken baked extra crispy and he tells me it was perfect. Our server checked back to see it was done as he desired. Then we had the cookie for desert.....I could go back now and have another one...so good!! I love this place and can't wait to go back!

Love this place was here last weekend and had breaded clams , club lucky salad and chicken fettuccine with asparagus and oil garlic. The meal was excellent as always.  I have been visiting this place for the last 5 years and have always enjoyed there martinis and food :)

Great food, great service. Call for reservations, seriously. Club Lucky continues to be a fave. I don't know who does the hiring here, but they do it right. The new bartender Kat is both lovely and excellent.

Super bummed guys. It's 9:15 and still haven't received my food. Ordered at 7:22pm. I know you use an outside company for deliveries, but c'mon. Sad because you're my fave. I can reheat food, but can't remove the disappointment.
If there is a more generous and delicious rack of ribs in Chicago, Id love to know about it! Excellent!

Fantastic lounge atmosphere.   Perfect music, bartender, and well mixed cocktail.   Exactly what we were after.   My boyfriend says they have one of the best Aviators in town.   I enjoyed my CL Blood and Sand.  This place will definitely be on our regular rotation.  Watch out though - the drinks are a little on the pricey side, but worth every penny.

We had a great dinner here celebrating a birthday.  The bday guest received a complimentary tiramisu that was the best I've ever had.  Service was prompt, personable and knowledgeable. Calamari was perfect. Eggplant parmesean got raves from a loyal eggplant parmesean eater. I loved the salmon dish I ordered (I can't remember whuch one...it had sauce and potatoes on the side) it was cooked perfectly and delicious.  Can't wait to go back.
Ambience is great and so is the food. Fun place to go and enjoy your meal while socializing. I had one of the best veal Parm dishes ever! The penne was perfectly al dente and the sauce was delicious!
Pure Italian food. Whatever form of 8-finger-rolled noodle I ate at Club Lucky was single handedly the best noodle type I've ever tasted. Club Lucky is a neighborhood staple.

Awesome place!! I love Italian food, but hate how stuffy some places can be. This place is super delicious and approachable (feels like you're back in the 60s!) On the flipside, if you're looking for something super romantical, then you probably won't find your fix here. I'll definitely be coming back for dinner, or even cocktails and apps!

A hidden gem! My husband and I come to club lucky for every valentines day celebration. The food is fantastic and the service is great. Make sure you go on an empty stomach because the portions are large and it is very delicious. The house martinis, like the lemon drop, are a perfect way to end the meal. There is booth seating that is preferred, but we've sat at the tables before and it is not too bad.

If you want some good, filling Italian food, this is the place to visit.  When I first walked in, I thought the place was a small bar with just a few seats but if you walk to the back, there is a big dining area.  The food is very filling, so if you are hungry, you better believe that you will leave here full and satified! It was the middle of the week and this place was packed with people. Try to get a booth if you can because there will be a tad bit of foot traffic.  Bring all of your friends and/or family, order different foods. There will be enough to share.  If you are in the neighborhood and just want to grab a few drinks, you can also do that here. There is a bar area when you first walk in that is separate from the dining area.
It's a great Italian restaurant with a nice service and the food is excellent.  The chicken parmesan is fantastic!
Ridiculous overpriced lasagna. For 16.95  you'll get an appetizer! Don't order hungry...
This review is for the bar- fabulous. A rare Chicago gem. Mixology is fantastic too. Jukebox is perfect and ambience is one of its kind. Can't wait to get back here
Really good italian food! Cool atmosphere as well - old school Italian. They have a bar in the front and full restaurant in the back. Definitely will go back.

I'm not sure why I waited so long to return to Club Lucky.  The atmosphere is always fun and lively - which I love.  Although I can't say that it's great for a first or second date when you're trying to get to know someone.  My date and I were trying to talk over the music and the surrounding conversation.  I don't know if the noise helped or hindered how the date was going ---- but that's another story. Anyway, the food is delicious as ever.  If I wasn't on a date, I would have asked for more bread!  We ordered the fried calamari and it was as good as I remembered.  My entrée of choice was the handmade chicken tortellini in a red cream sauce.  Simple but so tasty.  Yum! I will definitely be back sooner than later (sans date)!

I've been here a few times- once on a Sunday evening when the place was pretty busy but not packed to the gills; another time on a weekday in the very early evening/late afternoon when the place was empty; and once via takeout, which, granted, isn't really being there. I don't remember the quality of the service, but nothing stood out to me at the time as particularly slow or disappointing. The food, though, is incredible. I have wandered far and wide in Chicago to find the simple ravioli I'm looking for in a tomato sauce that accentuates but doesn't completely overkill the pasta. THIS is the ravioli of my dreams. It's ricotta filled, fresh, simple, delicious. I want to like a lot of the Italian places over on Grand Avenue, I thought I'd be impressed by La Scarola... but Club Lucky was just far, far better tasting. My husband had the chicken tortellini and said it was excellent. His only desire was for a bigger portion for the price. Yum!

It's a run of the mill Italian joint that tries extra hard to be old-school.  And while it somewhat succeeds on that front, it disappoints in just about every other aspect, making you wait way too long and pay way too much for mediocre food.  With so many spots in Chicago that are legitimately old-school (and not contrived), and so many spots in Chicago that offer superior meals at more reasonable pricing (and with actual service), I simply can't recommend Club Lucky.

We were coming from a show in the city and I wanted a restaurant with good food but we had my 82 year old mother in law and our 3 kids with us.  My friend suggested Club Lucky and we went for it.  WE LOVED IT!  The sausage and pepper appetizer was the most delicious sausage I had ever had, the calamari was cooked perfectly, I had the chicken francaise and it was delicious over sautéed spinach basically everything was fantastic.  It was loud but in a good way and the service was spot on.  Casual but nice old time feel with the vintage decor.  We had a great experience.
Awesome food. Slow service.  Order the Grilled Calamari!!! YUMM!! Linguine and white clam sauce.

Popped into Club Lucky last night and I loved it! Such an old school feel. I love the old juke box and the music on there is prefect...you won't find any music on there to twerk to, but you'll find some fun music to dance to.   The Calabrese Calamari was REALLY good and a little spicy...just the way I like it. It says it serves two, but it probably serves 3-4. The calamari is sautéed in calabrese cherry peppers, roasted garlic, white wine & fresh herbs The Baked Chicken Oreganato is great. I love lemon with my chicken and this cured my craving for lemon chicken. The chicken is baked with white wine, oregano, lemon, with a side of roasted potatoes.  Great staff. They are SO on top of it. My drink never went dry.  I can't wait to come back.

Club Lucky is an Italian place that has been around for quite some time now, so it may not wow you with new, inventive cuisine. But, there's a reason why Club Lucky has withstood the test of time. It's a classically themed, cozy Italian restaurant. The portions are generous (especially the pasta) and the martinis are great. Personally, I recommend the chicken vesuvio.

I have been coming here for many years and I have always been a huge fan..this last time, not so much.  After enjoying a drink at the bar we were seated at a 2 top against the wall where everyone and their mother walks past you, bumps into you, and interrupts your meal.  We had delicious appetizers of clams and the seafood salad along with their fantastic bread.  I ordered a special on the menu for my entree and when our food was ready, they brought me out a chicken dish instead of the shrimp dish I ordered.  Our server apologized and took it away but my husband was left to either eat without me or wait and have his food cold.  When my dish did come, it looked scorched on the top like it was put in a broiler to warm.  I was not impressed with my entree.  It actually tasted like macaroni & cheese with shrimp.  I didn't eat very much of it.  We went with the server's dessert recommendation of a chocolate chip type cake, which was very good but a bit too rich.  I'm hoping this was just an off night for us.  I love Club Lucky and have always looked forward to eating there.
Delicious Italian food and martinis! Pasta dishes are generously portioned and mouth watering. You always get lucky eating here. Get the calamari.

I have been coming to Club Lucky for a long time but have not been here recently. I have to say that I was disappointed. I am used to waiting in the bar area nursing a martini while you wait a bit for your table but having said that and waited our turn we were seated against the wall (no problem at first) thereby we got comfortable with the waiter promptly refreshing our drinks, when I realized that our aisle was like the Dan Ryan Expressway. I kid you not, both my menu and my wife's menus were separately knocked out of hands and the passing people never even flinched. I had several conversations with passing small children whose parents never realized they were mingling with the guests LOL. Even the staff was grinding against us while carrying ginormous food trays blah blah blah. Enough of that...lets talk food. I ordered mu usual Salmon Vesuvio and the wife ordered a seafood pasta special. This was preceded by little neck clams and the seafood salad. Both were good. The entrees came out after what seemed like a long time, but it just may have been that I was staffing the toll booth on the Dan Ryan...Anyway the waiter arrives and sets down my Vesuvio and my wife's chicken dish. Hold on doctor! She ordered a seafood pasta. Apologies...apologies...Now I have my dish and it sits alone as we converse. 10 minutes later her plate arrives with the top of the pasta slightly charred. Rush job...we accept it and say no more. It was not good. The waiter brings one complimentary glass of merlot even though we both have dinner cocktails and we order a chocolate cake fudge thingee...It was good. Overall I felt rushed...seated on a highway...disappointed. Next time I will not settle for that nonsense.

I really love this place during Christmastime...it's so cozy & old-school. We love to go sit at the bar and listen to the tunes & warm up under the decor. I haven't specifically gotten any entrees made vegan, but instead tend to choose random sides and make a hot mess of a meal. For example, a side of the roasted garlic (a whole head of perfectly roasted spreadable garlic) is awesome on toast, with a side of steamed broccoli or sauteed spinach or escarole. Or, a side of marinara w/roasted potatoes. Great Italian salad too sans cheese...sometimes it's not about what they can't do (at the least, you can get penne w/marinara and veggies) but that's a boring vegan option for me and it's fun to get wild with sides and be glad you're somewhere warm and cozy ;)

Really slow service and so so food. We had reservations on a Saturday night and were seated immediately. We put in our drink order and then began our wait. Nearly 10 minutes before the drinks were dropped off, the waitress said she would be right back, then spent the next 10 minutes taking care of a large party next to us.  The restaurant was fairly busy, but had about 20% of their tables open, so certainly not just temporarily overwhelmed.  We had another longer than normal wait after we ordered, and when the food did arrive, my order was wrong. Not wrong as in undercooked, or missing something on the side, but the entirely wrong dish. My wife started eating as we waited for them to spend the next 10-15 minutes making my correct dish.  The food (when it finally arrived) was fine, but found the sauces to be bland, and really nothing special otherwise.  Short from the brief apology, no effort was made to compensate for the extremely slow service or the incorrect dish. We paid our $75 tab and got out of there.  If you are looking for a casual Italian restaurant, look for something else in the neighborhood. I don't see any reason why we would return here.

In a city where you can be featured in Chicago Magazine's "Best New Restaurants" one month, and be closed for good just a short time later, it's pretty remarkable that Club Lucky has been holding its own for nearly 25 years. I visited last night, after not having dined there for a number of years, and was a bit surprised that the menu is pretty much exactly the same as it was when it first opened.  They're not reinventing the wheel here. You won't find carpaccio or risotto on the menu, but rather standard red-sauce Italian fare. It's reliable and enjoyable. The service is great. It walks that fine line between being attentive, but not pandering. Our server made great recommendations on cocktails and entrees, and she knew the menu well. Club Lucky kind of dropped off my radar over the years, but it's a solid choice for dependable, better-than-average Italian food.

This place sums up everything I love about Chicago.  You are walking down this beautiful residential street mixed with vintage low rises and ultra modern homes.  And there you spot an awning on the corner "Club Lucky" just tucked away all innocent and unnoticed aside from the valet sign which appears obviously out of place and unnecassary from what appears to be a neighborhood dive. Finally you walk in and boom!! Feels like the setting for a 50-60s mob movie. The front section has a nicely sized bar with TVs and some dineresque booth seating, very dark. Walk to the back section and get a seat in the well lit and fancier dining room. You sit down and feel like you'll spot Liotta, Pesci, and Deniro at another booth giving you the stink eye for finding their hideout.  You open the menu and can hardly decide between the seafood, pasta, steaks, wines,  etc.... Your food shows up and its just like Nonna woulda made it, I mean fah-getta-boutit! And the portion is also the way nonna woulda served it / fucking enormous. If you are looking for an authentic hidden Italian Gem, this is it. Mangare bene!

The food is fair. My big issue is with the leftover containers-they cram-and I mean cram-everything into a very small Chinese food container-even at the cost of cutting or folding your food up so it fits. Won't be back.

Classic. Been coming here my entire life. It's a great family place, but it's versatile enough to be your special date spot, too. You can't really go wrong at Club Lucky. I love the penne with meat sauce, chicken marsala, and shrimp scampi on spinach. Also best fried calamari in town!!!!

Talk about a true neighborhood restaurant. Club Lucky is Bucktown at its best. I have dinned there for years and even had family parties for special occasions. The food Is always great. The music and the decor are a blast from the past. This is a must when in the city.

Really fun, cool spot. Food was quite good but I have to admit not the absolute best Italian I've ever had.  Bartender also very friendly and nice, but please don't put a ton of sugar and blueberries in my old fashioned! What the heck!

Great bar atmosphere. The food was ok. A solid Italian, family-style meal. The service was pretty slow. I don't know if that was a result of there being several large tables, or if that's a normal Saturday night.

I came here to eat Wednesday night with a couple friends. Our waiter, Steve, was awesome. He gave us great recommendations and answered all our questions. The fried calamari was one of the best I've had. All of us enjoyed our dishes. We sat outside and it was very calm and relaxing. I would definitely recommend this place.

This place is set amoungst a residential neighborhood, so it attracts the youthful locals of this seemingly urban professional mixed with young white collar up-and-comer apartment dwellers, amidst vintage rehabs and occasional modern tear-downs, as well as every other person in the City who wants to make the very effective scene this place creates of a mix of great Italian comfort food, art deco and prohibition era decor, ... a social scene in the bar with a dinning experience to-boot.  It stands out on the corner with a throwback looking sign and you enter into its neon lit and subtly 20-30's decor, rounded edges and vinyl seating, art deco lighting and juke box.  After you pass through the bar you enter a dinning area to match with high celings and open kitchen.  In the summer the outdoor seating is cozy and on the sidewalk.  The menu brings you from top to bottom the usual great Italian dishes done right, easy, and gracefully fresh with great salad choices, appetizers you would expect and clever things that work like pork chops with pepperoncini peppers.  The red gravy sauce by which all Italian restaurants are to be judged, yummy to be sure.  Come for a Sunday family meal kids and all or come Friday or Saturday night with your date or friends to make the social scene in the bar and enjoy their many craft concoctions and have a great meal.
I like the food but the lighting and sound  are terrible in the dining room is terrible. I went there on Saturday and noticed every table around us using their phones to read the menu

Met a couple friends here for a little business meeting. First we had a couple drinks and an appetizer, then my friends left and my girlfriend and I actually also left, took a walk around the beautiful neighborhood, and then came back for dinner. Sat inside for the appetizers, and outside on the veranda for dinner. Everything was very, very good. First, the Decour and vibe of the place is awesome. Either it really is, or has been made to look exactly like a "Little Italy"Chicago restaurant from the 50s. Right down to the multicolored worn tile floor. They play cool music, not the tired old Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin Italian restaurant standards. The cocktails we had were outstanding. Well-made and not over complicated. Great drinks made by great bartenders, not "craft cocktail" nonsense. For food we had three appetizers, calamari, sausage and peppers, and their incredible fried artichoke. All wonderful. Get the calamari Calabrese style. For dinner we shared a pasta dish, again spot on, plus had an espresso and Italian cookies for dessert. Also had a glass of grappa which was one of the best I've had recently. We had the same server for both the appetizer and then when we came back for dinner. Of course she remembered us and took excellent care of us. Pretty much in a nutshell: Club Lucky is a fantastic neighborhood Italian restaurant that does everything right without being pretentious or stupid. Just a fantastic and well run restaurant. Highly recommended.
Great food. Large portions. Tiramisu and cannoli's are an absolute must try. Very homey feel.

This is a perfect spot for some delicious food! I have been there several times and have not been disappointed. The staff knows the menu well and can give you a recommendation when looking for one. I try to taste something new each time and honestly it has been fantastic.  I love that they link you directly to open table to make a reservation from their website. Like every truly good restaurant they have a lot of steady business, at times when I know I need to secure a table to maintain my schedule I use open table to ensure that happens.  One last suggestion their specials are always awesome. So don't miss out!  We drive 60 miles each way and keep coming back because we truly enjoy!

We had our wedding reception here, after going here to eat more times than I can count.  Everything was absolutely, positively perfect.  Being in the hospitality business for well over 20 years, I am wired to look for issues and solutions.  Frankly, there was not a single thing we would have changed. The owner and managers were so easy to work with in the planning, the staff on site were amazing and the food was great (we had family style)   Honestly, we could have easily spent 4x the amount we did and the reception would not have been better. Highly recommend if you have the need for a locally owned, caring food destination for a group.  Again, was perfect. How often can someone say that about a wedding reception!!!

Ate here last week. Food was absolutely amazing, as usual. However, the service was less than desired. The bus and support staff was more attentive than our server. Had to ask for our bill, wrong meal was brought for one of our guest. The rest of us had to eat cold food. Nothing was done to rectify.  Very disappointed for a $95 bill.

I have now been going to Club Lucky a few years...promoting them to a four (maybe a 3.5 is more fair). It is a nice neighborhood type of place. Nothing extraordinary but comfortable and unpretentious. There is one server (who actually also does standup comedy) whose name I have forgotten...she is a bundle of character and a joy to chat with. Bread is delicious. Food, depending on what you order is reasonable to delicious. Price-Value-Ratio as the Dutch would call it is fair.

I will start by saying that this is by no means the best Italian food I've ever had, but our experience here was so great that I had to give it five stars anyway. We first went to Club Lucky on a Speakeasy tour. We learned about it's Mob background (look for the bullet still lodged in the bar!), which was very cool. The atmosphere inside was awesome, and the drinks we had were good. We were excited to come back again. We went last night and had one of the best experiences we've had in a while. The service was just excellent. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our waiter was one of the best I've ever had at a restaurant up there. They just made you feel welcome. The sangria was delicious, as was the bread with olive oil and the toasted ravioli. It is pricey, yes, but we didn't mind. We were also able to sit outside, and the cute, quiet neighborhood made that an enjoyable experience, as well. We're excited to go back!

This place is so awesome. I like how its in the neighborhood but only a block away from a busy street. Started out with the Antipasto Meat & Cheese tray and it had tons of goodies on it. Also tried the Calamari Calabrese which is the most tender calamari i have ever eaten and very task. For my meal, my mother and i split an order of lasagna which was great and the steak pizzaola which was so awesome. My step-dad has the eggplant parm, which he enjoyed.  For dessert, cheesecake, tiramisu and i had strawberry with chocolate chip gelato. I will be there again and I hope you try it. Staff was great and service was great.

I really don't understand how anyone can dine at Club Lucky when Lucia's is just a few blocks away. Lucia's is really quite good. Club Lucky was just a big disappointment. We tried three things and all three were mediocre at best. The only good thing was that we didn't get sick. Go to Lucia's on North Ave.

Calamari. I will say it again. Calamari. Club Lucky does it amazingly well. Huge pieces of squid fried to perfection beneath a light coating. Not heavy at all, and it comes with a heavenly marinara dipping sauce. The sauce could have used a little spice but it definitely didn't take away from the overall result. This place is perfect for a quiet dinner for two or a small group. And if it's nice outside, don't pass up the opportunity to sit on the patio.  Our server was phenomenal: attentive and personable and just downright a nice guy. In fact, everyone we encountered there was polite and welcoming. My husband and I split the Meatball Insalata and Chicken Cacciatore. The meatballs were large and in charge, drowned in a sweet and beautifully red tomato sauce. They come alongside a basic house salad dressed in red wine vinaigrette. It felt light and yet very filling and comforting. The Chicken Cacciatore was divine, with the chicken browned nicely on the outside but super moist on the inside. Sadly, we were too full for dessert, but I have no doubt we will be back again soon and will make room. Club Lucky: I'm the lucky one for trying this place!
